clinical_study.brief_title: Physical Activity Program Implementation in Hospitalized Positive Covid-19 Older Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility and Effect of Implementing Physical Activity Program Implementation During Covid-19 in Hospitalized Positive Covid-19 Older Adults

brief_summary.textblock: Our hypothesis was that physical activity program will be acceptable and may counteract physical and mental decline among older adults hospitalized in covid-19 unit

detailed_description.textblock:
The 30 second chair test, balance with joint-feet and semi-tandem stance, and 4 meters comfortable walking test were evaluated. Depending on their score, a specific PA program was selected and explained. The program was printed, explained and lefted in the room. This intervention included 5 different PA programs.
Final evaluation (one day before leaving the unit) recording physical performance (same physical tests used for inclusion evaluation), HAD score, ADL and self-satisfaction of the program.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of adherence of the intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 15 days
primary_outcome.description: adherence of the intervention evaluated by the number of completed exercise days compared to the number of total intervention days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 15 days
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison between inclusion and final physical performances measured by the 30-second chair test, balance with joint-feet, semi-tandem stance, 4 meters comfortable walking test, functional abilities with the evaluation of ADL score and HAD scores.

arm_group.description: Patients aged 75 years and over Hospitalized in a French covid-19 geriatric unit Positive Covid-19 infection made by Real-time Polymerase Chain Reaction Covid-19 or suspected on thoracic lesions on computerized tomography.

intervention.description: 30 second chair test, balance with joint-feet and semi-tandem stance 4 meters comfortable walking test were evaluated

study_pop.textblock: Included in a French covid-19 geriatric unit in Toulouse, hospitalized for a positive covid-19 infection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 75 years and over
- Hospitalized in a French covid-19 geriatric unit
- Positive Covid-19 infection made by Real-time Polymerase Chain Reaction Covid-19 or suspected on thoracic lesions on computerized tomography.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Exclusion of patients of palliative care,
- Severe dementia or Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE) [14] below 18/30
- Acute covid-19 complication.
- Activities of Daily Living < 2/6
